resources.string: Data types specify the different sizes and values that can be stored in the variable. There are two types of data types in Java:
1.Primitive data types: The primitive data types include boolean, char, byte, short, int, long, float and double.
2.Non-primitive data types: The non-primitive data types include Classes, Interfaces, and Arrays(This data types will be explain in other part).
A loop statement use to execute a statement or group statement multiple times. And in loop control, there are 3 different types of loop.
The while loop is used to repeat execute the block of code. It will keep repeat execute until the meet the condition.
Automatically download attachments for incoming emails
Only download attachments when manually requested

Following the code, the while loop is going to executed the statements - Hello World 5 times. It is because the condition has given less the 6, and it not going to execute more the 5 times. Therefore the result output will print Hello World 5 times. To get more easy to understand how it work. There is a flowchart.

Following the code, the control falls into the for loop. The initialization is done, and it jumps to condition. If condition is true, it keep execute. If condition is false, it ends the loop. And the result output will print Hello World 5 times. To get more easy to understand how it work. There is a flowchart.

Following the code, the control falls into the do-while loop. When statement get executed, it jumps to the condition. If condition is true, it return to the statement, and repeat the step again. If condition is false, and it end the executed. And the result will print Hello World 5 times.
This is application is base on a personal project. It would not ask any user information. No login or registration require. Hope everyone can learn the basic Java language in this application.
In Java, object have states and behaviors. And class is like an object constructor for creating objects.
In this example of code, we have created an object called myObj. And our class name is objectClass. And the code print the value of x is 5.
This is a similar example. What the difference in this code, in one class we can have multiple objects. Therefore, the code will print 5 and 6.
The operator in java language is used to perform operation on variables and values.
It is same as the math, [+] is use to adds two values or more together. [-] is use to subtract one value from another.
Java is a very sensitive programming language. Which mean Hello and hello are different in Java.
Normally in Java, we often start the method name as lower case letter.
